meanings.definition: To fall or let fall in a downward direction.
meanings.sent1: The apple dropped from the tree.
meanings.sent2: I accidentally dropped my pencil on the floor.
meanings.sent3: The raindrop dropped from the cloud with a tiny splash.
meanings.sent4: Her heart dropped when she heard the bad news.
meanings.sent5: The temperature dropped suddenly, making everyone shiver.

meanings.definition: To decrease or diminish in amount or value.
meanings.sent1: The price of the toy dropped after the sale.
meanings.sent2: His energy level dropped as the day went on.
meanings.sent3: The excitement in the room dropped when the lights went out.
meanings.sent4: Her smile dropped when she realized she forgot her homework.
meanings.sent5: The number of attendees dropped significantly at the event.

meanings.sent1: The postman dropped the package at the doorstep.
meanings.sent2: She dropped the letter into the mailbox.
meanings.sent3: The magician dropped the curtain to reveal a surprise.
meanings.sent4: He dropped the bombshell news during the meeting.
meanings.sent5: The singer dropped her new album on streaming platforms.

meanings.sent1: She dropped her gym membership due to lack of time.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to drop the project halfway through.
meanings.sent3: He dropped the idea of going on a vacation this summer.
meanings.sent4: The teacher dropped the assignment deadline for the students.
meanings.sent5: They dropped the plan to renovate the house after considering the costs.

meanings.sent1: The cat dropped its fur during shedding season.
meanings.sent2: He dropped a few pounds after starting a new diet.
meanings.sent3: She dropped her inhibitions and danced freely at the party.
meanings.sent4: The tree dropped its leaves in the autumn breeze.
meanings.sent5: He dropped his old habits to embrace a healthier lifestyle.
